mdRecord.dcterms:title: 12 blade scarificator
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: George Tiemann & Company
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This instrument was owned by Dr. James E. Copeland (1845-1937) of Round Hill, Virginia. It was donated to the University of Virginia by Copeland's grandson, Edward V. Copeland, in 1971. The scarificator is stamped with the following text: Tiemann. Contained in a box with two labels. One label has the following text: Geo. Tiemann Manufacturer of Surgical Instruments and every description of Cutlery No. 63 Chatham Street New York. The second label has the following text: Dr. J.E. Copeland, Rectortwon, Va.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments and apparatus
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
